trans-unit.source: Represents a custom configuration element that defines a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEndpoint"></xref> in a configuration file.
Web scripting enables working with the data entered onto a web page.
Initiates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WebScriptEndpointElement"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the name of the group of behaviors and metadata that produce the web document configured by the current <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WebScriptEndpointElement"></xref>.
The name of a content type.
Initiates a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEndpoint"></xref> with the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription>.

An object whose properties define an endpoint’s characteristics, including - the signature of the operations in terms of messages exchanged - the data types of these messages, the location of the operations - the specific protocols and serialization formats that are used to support successful communication with the service
A web script endpoint.
Gets or sets whether different host computers can access each others’ scripts.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if cross domain script access is enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the type of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEndpoint"></xref>.
An web script endpoint object.
Specifies how the host name should be used in URI comparisons when dispatching an incoming message to a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEndpoint"></xref>.
Comparison mode settings refer to the StrongWildcard, Exact, and WeakWildcard descriptions.
An enumerated description of a comparison mode.
Gets or sets the maximum size, in bytes, of any buffer pools used by the message transport.
The maximum buffer pool size.
Gets or sets the maximum size, in bytes, of the buffer used to receive messages.
The maximum buffer size.
Gets or sets the maximum byte size of messages received by a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEndpoint"></xref>.
The maximum byte size.
Converts the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> to a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEndpoint"></xref>.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> to convert.
Not used.
Converts the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> to a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEndpoint"></xref>.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> to convert.
Not used.
Initializes and verifies the format of the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ChannelEndpointElement"></xref> and configures it to include web HTTP binding content.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ChannelEndpointElement"></xref> to be initialized.
Initializes and verifies the format of the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceEndpointElement"></xref> and configures it to include web HTTP binding content.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceEndpointElement"></xref> to be initialized.
Gets all the properties attached to the current <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEndpoint"></xref>.
A collection of endpoint element properties.
Gets a configuration element that defines the constraints on the complexity of messages that can be processed by <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEndpoint"></xref> objects.
A configuration element that defines Xml dictionary reader quotas.
Gets an HTTP web security binding element.
A web script endpoint configuration element.
Gets or sets the manner in which WCF messages are transported.
Examples of message transfer types include buffered and streamed.
An object that contains a string that designates a WCF message transfer mode.
Gets or sets the encoding that is used to format the characters in a text message.
The character encoding.
